answers.answer: The best advice I can give you is if you do not have confidence in  the oral surgeon then get another opinion. I think that if you are seeing some improvement then 3 or 4 days will not cause and significant problems.
i would gt a second opinion from a different oral surgeon.

A dry socket shouldn't take this long to heal.  Do you have any other medical conditions?  There are many systemic conditions that may impede healing, including diabetes, or other diseases that reduce immunity.  If you smoke, stop.  Another possibile solution would be to surgically debride the area.  The tissues can be repositioned/sutured  to close over the bone, after the bone is thoroughly debrided.
